noun.description: A tower or pit on a farm used to store grain.
An underground chamber in which a guided missile is kept ready for firing.
A system, process, department, etc. that operates in isolation from others.
examples: it's vital that team members step out of their silos and start working together
we have made significant strides in breaking down that silo mentality

verb.description: Isolate (one system, process, department, etc.) from others.
examples: most companies have expensive IT systems they have developed over the years, but they are siloed
why are so many companies still siloing their SEO and social media marketing?

origin: Mid 19th century: from Spanish, via Latin from Greek siros corn pit.
